title: EnglishPod 初级 英文播客 0073

segments.en: Hello everyone, welcome back to EnglishPod.
And today we're at a wedding ceremony.
segments.cn: 今天我们在一个婚礼上。

segments.en: But of course it wouldn't be EnglishPod unless we have something unexpected happening at this wedding.
segments.cn: 当然，如果这个婚礼没有意外发生，那就不是EnglishPod了。

segments.en: Okay, so we're going to be talking about hands.
But Marco, what is there to say about a hand?
segments.cn: 但是Marco，手有什么好说的呢？

segments.en: Well, as you may or may not know, each finger has a name on your hand.
segments.cn: 嗯，正如你可能知道的，每个手指都有一个名字。

segments.en: So we're going to learn what those names are in English.
segments.cn: 所以我们要学习这些名字的英语。

segments.en: And also we're going to learn about some common phrases that you might hear in an English wedding.
segments.cn: 还要学习一些你可能在英语婚礼上听到的常用短语。

segments.en: Exactly, because I think exactly because usually it's old English.
segments.cn: 没错，因为我觉得通常是古英语。

segments.en: Maybe English that's not used anymore.
segments.cn: 可能是现在不再使用的英语。

segments.en: Alright, well I'm excited to find out what this unexpected event is.
segments.cn: 好吧，我很期待这个意外事件是什么。

segments.en: May this ring be blessed, so he who gives it and she who wears it may abide in peace and continue in love until life's end.
segments.cn: 愿这枚戒指被祝福，愿给予它的人和佩戴它的人在平安中生活，直到生命的尽头。

segments.en: With this ring I be wed, wear it as a symbol of our love and commitment.
segments.cn: 以这枚戒指我结婚，佩戴它作为我们爱与承诺的象征。

segments.en: That ring goes on the ring finger.
segments.cn: 那个戒指应该戴在无名指上。

segments.en: Alright, embarrassing moments for the groom.
segments.cn: 好吧，给新郎带来了尴尬的时刻。

segments.en: Confusing the fingers in front of all his friends and family.
segments.cn: 在他所有的朋友和家人面前搞混手指。

segments.en: So I mentioned before that we're gonna learn the names of each finger in your hand, so let's get started.
segments.cn: 我之前提到过，我们要学习每个手指的名字，所以让我们开始吧。

segments.en: Let's take a look at these in language takeaway.
segments.cn: 让我们看看这些语言要点。

segments.en: Alright, well why don't we start with the smallest finger on your hand?
segments.cn: 好吧，我们为什么不从你手上最小的手指开始呢？

segments.en: The smallest finger on your hand.
Sometimes people call it the little finger.
segments.cn: 有时人们称它为小手指。

segments.en: And the next finger is the one the groom couldn't find.
segments.cn: 下一个手指是新郎找不到的那个。

segments.en: So this is, of course, like the name says, where the wedding ring is usually placed.
segments.cn: 所以这就是，当然，像名字所说的，婚戒通常放在这里。

segments.en: Now the next one is a controversial finger.
segments.cn: 现在下一个是一个有争议的手指。

segments.en: That must be the middle finger.
Well, you know, if you put your middle finger up like you're doing right now to me.
segments.cn: 嗯，你知道，如果你像现在这样把中指竖起来。

segments.en: And all other fingers down, you are making a very rude gesture.
segments.cn: 其他手指都放下，你就是在做一个非常粗鲁的手势。

segments.en: So what would you call that?
I would call that giving the middle finger.
Or, I've also heard the phrase, flip someone off.
segments.cn: 或者，我也听过这个短语，给某人竖中指。

segments.en: Yes, or also flip the bird.
segments.cn: 是的，或者也可以说翻鸟。

segments.en: So all phrases that you can use when you are showing only your middle finger to somebody.
segments.cn: 所以这些短语都是在你只向某人展示中指时可以使用的。

segments.en: Unless somebody deserves it, I guess.
segments.cn: 除非某人值得这样做，我想。

segments.en: We won't talk about that, but what we will talk about is the next finger.
segments.cn: 我们不谈这个，但我们要谈的是下一个手指。

segments.en: So this is the finger you use to point.
segments.cn: 这是你用来指向的手指。

segments.en: Any idea why they call it the index finger?
segments.cn: 你知道为什么叫食指吗？

segments.en: Because when you're looking through the index of a book, you always use this finger.
segments.cn: 因为当你查看一本书的索引时，你总是用这个手指。

segments.en: Right, I think you also use this finger to pass pages on a book, right?
segments.cn: 对，我想你也用这个手指翻书，对吧？

segments.en: Okay, don't believe anything I just told you.
segments.cn: 好吧，不要相信我刚才告诉你的任何事情。

segments.en: Maybe you guys know the real answer to this.
segments.cn: 也许你们知道这个真正的答案。

segments.en: And our last finger, the most important one.
segments.cn: 我们最后一个手指，最重要的一个。

segments.en: Okay, so that's the short but fat finger.
segments.cn: 好的，这就是短而粗的手指。

segments.en: The one that you use to play PlayStation.
Do you say the B at the end of this word?
segments.cn: 你在这个词的结尾说B吗？

segments.en: No, I actually only pronounce the M.
Yeah, you wouldn't say the thumb.
Okay, so now that we're clear on all five fingers, let's listen to our dialogue again and then we'll come back and talk about these difficult phrases that the priest used.
segments.cn: 好的，现在我们对五个手指都清楚了，让我们再听一遍对话，然后我们再回来讨论神父使用的这些难句。

segments.en: May this ring be blessed, so he who gives it and she who wears it may abide in peace and continue in love until life's end.
segments.cn: 愿这戒指被祝福，愿给予它的人和佩戴它的人在平安中生活，直到生命的尽头。

segments.en: With this ring, I be wed, wear it as a symbol of our love and commitment.
segments.cn: 以这戒指，我愿结婚，将其作为我们爱与承诺的象征。

segments.en: That ring goes on the ring finger.
segments.cn: 那个戒指戴在无名指上。

segments.en: Well, this is really common wedding speak, isn't it?
segments.cn: 嗯，这真是常见的婚礼用语，不是吗？

segments.en: That's what usually the priest or the person who is marrying somebody would say.
segments.cn: 这通常是神父或主持婚礼的人会说的。

segments.en: Well, why don't you look at some of these phrases now because it's really interesting to talk about their meaning.
segments.cn: 那么，为什么你现在不看看这些短语，因为讨论它们的意思真的很有趣。

segments.en: So, what does it mean when you bless something or someone?
segments.cn: 那么，祝福某物或某人是什么意思？

segments.en: Well, usually the religious leader does this, right?
segments.cn: 通常是宗教领袖这样做，对吧？

segments.en: And he's giving good wishes to that thing.
segments.cn: 他是在给予那个事物美好的祝愿。

segments.en: Could be for an object or to a person, right?
segments.cn: 可以是对物体或对人的，对吧？

segments.en: You can be blessed as well.
And so these good wishes usually come from God.
segments.cn: 所以这些美好的祝愿通常来自上帝。

segments.en: So, what about our next phrase?
segments.cn: 那我们的下一个短语呢？

segments.en: Yeah, but it's very fancy and I don't know if you use it anymore.
segments.cn: 是的，但这很正式，我不知道你是否还在使用它。

segments.en: No, I think you would never use this word in conversation or even very rarely in writing.
segments.cn: 不，我认为你在对话中永远不会使用这个词，甚至在写作中也很少。

segments.en: Okay, what about our next phrase?
I like this and it's the common phrase you'll hear in all movies and in all marriages.
segments.cn: 我喜欢这个，这是你在所有电影和婚礼中都会听到的常见短语。

segments.en: With this ring I thee wed.
With this ring I thee wed.
With this ring I thee wed.
Okay, we've got two words in here that are also older English words.
segments.cn: 好的，这里有两个词也是古英语词。

segments.en: So, this is a middle English term for you.
segments.cn: 这是中世纪英语中“你”的说法。

segments.en: So, can I say I love thee?
That would be very romantic but also inappropriate for the office.
segments.cn: 那会很浪漫，但在办公室里也不合适。

segments.en: I guess you would, if you're reading Shakespeare, you would definitely come upon this, right?
segments.cn: 我想如果你在读莎士比亚，你肯定会遇到这个，对吧？

segments.en: This is also an old verb for the action of marrying someone.
segments.cn: 这也是一个古老的动词，表示与某人结婚的动作。

segments.en: So, I can say we will be wed next year.
segments.cn: 所以，我可以说我们明年结婚。

segments.en: But don't say that now because you'll sound quite silly.
segments.cn: 但现在不要这样说，因为你会听起来很傻。

segments.en: But it's good to know, especially if you guys are reading something a little bit more classical.
segments.cn: 但知道这些是好的，特别是如果你们在读一些更经典的东西。

segments.en: Or you plan to get married to an English person.
segments.cn: 或者你打算嫁给一个英国人。

segments.en: Wear it as a symbol of our love and commitment.
segments.cn: 将其作为我们爱与承诺的象征。

segments.en: Wear it as a symbol of our love and commitment.
segments.cn: 将其作为我们爱与承诺的象征。

segments.en: So, now he's referring to the rings, right?
segments.cn: 所以，现在他指的是戒指，对吧？

segments.en: Wear the ring as a symbol, a sign, a representation of love and commitment.
segments.cn: 将戒指作为爱与承诺的象征、标志、代表。

segments.en: So, why would you wear a ring as a symbol of something?
segments.cn: 那么，为什么你要将戒指作为某种象征佩戴？

segments.en: Well, obviously, you know, love, you can't see it, you can't touch it.
segments.cn: 嗯，显然，你知道，爱是看不见的，摸不着的。

segments.en: So, you need something to show you that it's there.
segments.cn: 所以，你需要一些东西来证明它的存在。

segments.en: So, you need a sign of that love.
segments.cn: 所以，你需要一个爱的标志。
一些你可以看到的东西。

segments.en: So, that's what the ring represents.
segments.cn: 所以，这就是戒指所代表的。

segments.en: But how about this word commitment?
A commitment is a strong promise.
segments.cn: 承诺是一个强烈的承诺。

segments.en: So, you promise to love that person to take care of them.
segments.cn: 所以，你承诺去爱那个人，照顾他们。

segments.en: So, now we are a little bit more familiar with some of the language you hear in a wedding ceremony.
segments.cn: 所以，现在我们对婚礼仪式中听到的一些语言更加熟悉了。

segments.en: And we also know all of the names of the fingers.
segments.cn: 我们也知道所有手指的名称。

segments.en: So, why don't we listen to the dialogue one more time to hear these all in context.
segments.cn: 那么，我们再听一遍对话，听听这些内容的上下文。

segments.en: So, he who gives it and she who wears it may abide in peace and continue in love until life's end.
segments.cn: 这样，给予它的人和佩戴它的人可以在平安中生活，继续相爱直到生命的尽头。

segments.en: With this ring I be wed, wear it as a symbol of our love and commitment.
segments.cn: 以这枚戒指我结婚，佩戴它作为我们爱与承诺的象征。

segments.en: That ring goes on the ring finger.
segments.cn: 那个戒指戴在无名指上。

segments.en: Alright, so now it's perfectly clear and a romantic dialogue in the end.
segments.cn: 好吧，现在一切都很清楚，最后是一个浪漫的对话。

segments.en: Now, we have different types of rings, right?
segments.cn: 现在，我们有不同类型的戒指，对吧？

segments.en: We have the wedding ring, the one that we just heard.
segments.cn: 我们有婚戒，就是我们刚刚听到的那个。

segments.en: But we also have an engagement ring.
In most English-speaking countries, the woman is very, very lucky because she gets two rings.
segments.cn: 在大多数英语国家，女性非常幸运，因为她可以得到两个戒指。

segments.en: So, when the man asks her to marry him, he gives her a diamond.
segments.cn: 所以，当男人向她求婚时，他会给她一颗钻石。

segments.en: And it's really, really important that he does this.
segments.cn: 而且他这样做真的非常重要。

segments.en: And it's also really important that he spends a lot of money on the diamond.
segments.cn: 而且他在钻石上花很多钱也很重要。

segments.en: And the tradition is you must spend at least one month's salary.
segments.cn: 传统是你必须花费至少一个月的工资。

segments.en: So, the girl gets a diamond engagement ring and then on wedding day, she gets the wedding ring.
segments.cn: 所以，女孩得到一枚钻石订婚戒指，然后在婚礼当天，她得到婚戒。

segments.en: And usually, will she wear both of them?
segments.cn: 通常，她会同时佩戴这两个戒指吗？

segments.en: Yeah, she'll always wear both of them.
segments.cn: 是的，她会一直佩戴这两个戒指。

segments.en: So, the engagement ring goes closest to you and then the wedding ring on top.
segments.cn: 所以，订婚戒指靠近你，然后婚戒在上面。

segments.en: And the engagement ring, it represents the commitment to marry her.
segments.cn: 而订婚戒指代表着对她的婚姻承诺。

segments.en: The commitment from the man to marry her.
segments.cn: 这是男人对她的婚姻承诺。

segments.en: Okay, so it's a symbol that they will get married.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以这是他们将要结婚的象征。

segments.en: It's a symbol of the promise.
Now, what happens if they break up and they don't get married?
segments.cn: 现在，如果他们分手而不结婚，会发生什么？

segments.en: Does he get the ring back?
If he was a jerk, no.
segments.cn: 如果他是个混蛋，那就不行。

segments.en: But if it was sort of like a happy breakup, then okay.
segments.cn: 但如果是那种愉快的分手，那就可以。

segments.en: I guess it's a big risk, right?
segments.cn: 我想这是一种很大的风险，对吧？

segments.en: Alright, so that's all for today, guys.
segments.cn: 好吧，今天就到这里，大家。

segments.en: Let us know if you guys have any interesting wedding stories.
segments.cn: 如果你们有任何有趣的婚礼故事，请告诉我们。

segments.en: I know that sometimes weddings can be embarrassing.
segments.cn: 我知道有时候婚礼可能会很尴尬。

segments.en: Maybe I've seen the groom faint.
Or even fall in a pool.
So, if you have any stories, please share them with us.
segments.cn: 所以，如果你有任何故事，请与我们分享。

segments.en: And also, if you have any questions or doubts, Eric and I are always there to answer them.
segments.cn: 如果你有任何问题或疑虑，埃里克和我总是会回答你们。
